title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1 OUT-OF-SCHOOL CHILDREN

description.narrative: Output 1 (Out-of-school children): National and subnational governments and partners have improved capacity and mechanisms to implement effective strategies and programmes that provide quality learning opportunities for out-of-school children and prevent students from dropping out of school., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: An increasing proportion of girls and boys, across the life cycle, especially the most disadvantaged, are learning in quality, safe and inclusive environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1 (Out-of-school children): National and subnational governments and partners have improved capacity and mechanisms toimplement effective strategies and programmes that provide quality learning opportunities for out-of-school children and preventstudents from dropping out of school.

description.narrative: Output 4.1 results are partially met. Good practices for assisting out-of-school children (OOSC) were expanded to 15 districts through implementation of local government action plans. Skills and knowledge were built by 1,283 district and village government stakeholders on child-centered planning and budgeting, leading to resource prioritization for 400 OOSC and 1,496 children at-risk of dropping out of school (43% girls; 57% boys) to continue learning. Nationwide monitoring of OOSC continued across all 33 provinces, with an increase in the number of OOSC identified. UNICEF led research to inform improvements to the national social protection programme to more effectively reach OOSC. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:03/12/2021

title.narrative: Existence of a national gender-responsive policy (Presidential Regulation) on out-of-school children, Text

actual.value: 2021:An action plan framework has been developed which will be used as a basis to establish a national action plan on out-of-school children. A national action plan is a key document that need to be provided prior to the drafting of a presidential regulation.

title.narrative: Existence of a national gender-responsive policy (Presidential Regulation) on out-of-school children, Text

actual.value: 2021:An action plan framework has been developed which will be used as a basis to establish a national action plan on out-of-school children. A national action plan is a key document that need to be provided prior to the drafting of a presidential regulation.
